author: Scott, Walter
snippet: But, Jeanie lass, what bringsyou out to Libberton sae air in the morning, and your fatherlying ill in the Luckenbooths ?"

title: The Novels of Sir Walter Scott, Bart. With all his introductions and notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: As Saddletree had two childrenboarded with Wbackbairn, and was, as we have seen, ratherfond of Butler's society, he turned his palfrey's head towardsLibberton, and came, as we have already said, to give theunfortunate usher that additional vexation, of which Imogenecomplains so feelingly, when she says,—

title: The Novels of Sir Walter Scott, Bart. With all his introductions and notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: " Just Reuben Butler, that's schulemaster at Libberton,"said Jeanie.

title: The Novels of Sir Walter Scott, Bart. With all his introductions and notes.
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Butler, after a close investigation of hisconduct, was declared innocent of accession to the death ofPorteous ; but, as baring been present during tbe whole transaction, was obliged to find bail not to quit his usual residenceat Libberton, that he might appear as a witness when calledupon.

snippet: " It's Mr. Butler from Libberton," said a voice from behind ;" he'll discharge the duty as weel as ony man."

snippet: " Ay, ye need say nae mair about it; if there was a lairdthat had a puir kinsman, or a bastard that it wad suit, there'seneugh said.—And ye're e'en come back to Libberton to waitfor dead men's shoon ?—and, for as frail as Mr. Wbackbairn is,
